DataElement.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Domestic Partnership Spouse Complain Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person's spouse or domestic partner has expressed feelings of pain, dissatisfaction, or resentment as a result of that person's maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Domestic Partnership Spouse Complain Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's spouse or domestic partner expressing feelings of pain, dissatisfaction, or resentment as a result of that person's maladaptive use of prescription drugs, substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional, illegal drugs, substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction, or over-the-counter drugs, medicine that can be bought without a prescription, that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Concepts.definition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Property.preferredName: Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Domestic Partnership Spouse Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.:A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.:A person who is a member of an unmarried couple, including same sex couples, living together in long standing relationships that are registered or un-registered.:A person's partner in marriage.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.
A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.
Indicates a person who is a member of an unmarried couple, including same sex couples, living together in longstanding relationships, that are registered or unregistered.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does your spouse (or parents)
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does your spouse (or parents) ever complain about your involvement with drugs?
